intro: Espeletia platylepis, commonly known as the broad-leaved espeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its rosette growth form. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Espeletia platylepis is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in the cool, moist conditions of cloud forests. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of the local ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
